Description: Mouth sherd of Attic black-figured large pottery aryballos; interior: glazed black with single band in added red; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of frieze of geese to left (tail feathers with red of left goose, middle goose with red feathers, and head and shoulders of third goose remain); incised rosette as filling ornament; underside: glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Attributed by Venit to Sophilos or near him. The shape is difficult to pin down.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 21, pl. 28, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1968)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Donated to the museum by Mlle Habineau?
